alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock; Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 22 at 6:10PM CST until February 23 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: Wind Chill Warning is in effect for eastern Colorado, southwest Nebraska and portions of northwest Kansas from 2am MST to 8am MST. A Wind Chill Advisory will go into effect from 8am MST to 12pm MST after the warning expires. The current wind chill advisory continues. Wind Chill Warning and Wind Chill Advisory in effect tonight through Wednesday morning. * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills as low as 25 below are expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Kansas, east central and northeast Colorado and southwest Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 2 AM MST /3 AM CST/ to 8 AM MST /9 AM CST/ Wednesday. The Wind Chill Advisory remains in effect until noon MST/ 1pm CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The coldest wind chills over the entire area will occur around sunrise and last through mid morning. Be sure to dress in layers along with a coat and hat for the morning commute to work and school.
info.instruction: If you must go outside, wear multiple layers of clothing including a hat and gloves. Frostbite causes loss of feeling and color around the face, fingers, and toes. Signs of frostbite include numbness and white, grayish-yellow, firm, or waxy skin. Hypothermia is an unusually low body temperature. A body temperature below 95 degrees is an emergency. Signs of hypothermia include shivering, exhaustion, confusion, fumbling hands, memory loss, slurred speech, or drowsiness.
